Getting started

Applications built using the form.io platform benefit from fast development, a unified form and API architecture as well as instant updates within the app.

These tutorials and starterkit applications are great ways to start out developing with form.io. However, they do make certain choices about 3rd party libraries such as angular-ui-router or react-router. If you aren't sure about the best way to get started with our platform, these starterkits should make your job much easier. If you already have a lot of experience and would like to use our basic directives and components to build your own libraries using a different technology stack then our software will work very well for that as well.

So watch the videos, Read the Help Docs, and check out these libraries to help get you going!

1. Exploring the Form.io Portal

Angular 1.x

Libraries

  • ng-app-starterkit
  • ngFormio - Form Renderer
  • ngFormBuilder - Form Builder
  • ngFormioGrid - Data Grid
  • ngFormioHelper - Application Helper

This playlist shows how to use ng-app-starterkit to build an Angular 1.x app.
